page.title: 17Redundant Mills - Darwen
page.content:
One of the major{changes}in Darwen since the Second World war has been the{closure of textile mills}and their {conversion}to a variety of other uses - mainly to division into units. In a survey of two mills, Cotton Hall Mill and Hollins Grove Mill, the following types of businesses were discovered: {services services services to industry to the public to both H.G. 6 3 6 C.H. 6 4 1
Services to industry include: engineering(5), sign writing(1), leather goods(1), rubber rollers(1), carpet cleaning(1), packaging(1). Services to the public include: car repairs(5), building and joinery(4).
